page.title: 02History of Fletchertown.
page.content: Fletchertown was built in 1880.The village was built for coal miners and their families who went to work in the mine.The National School was built before Fletchertown. It was built in 1854.It was called Allhallows The school was enlarged in 1880.There is a foundation stone that gives the date when the school was enlarged.The stone was laid by Mrs George Moore on the 12th of January 1880.The school was enlarged because there was so many children,in Fletchertown. Front Street and Quarry Street were built after 1893.They are built of brick and the others are built of sand stone.There are bungalows and houses in Fletchertown the total number of dwellings is 133. The Wesleyan Chapel was built in 1894.There was another chapel in Fletchertown but is not there now.
